name: Santorini
quick_fact: Santorini was formed by a volcanic eruption that destroyed the center of a circular island, creating the iconic caldera we see today.
best_season: April to June and September to October for pleasant weather and fewer crowds

name: Machu Picchu
quick_fact: Machu Picchu sits at 2,430 meters (7,970 feet) above sea level and was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983.
best_season: May to September during the dry season with clear skies

name: Safari in Serengeti
quick_fact: The Serengeti is home to over 3 million large mammals, making it one of the most biodiverse ecosystems in the world.
best_season: June to October for the Great Migration and dry season wildlife viewing

name: Tokyo
quick_fact: Tokyo is the world's most populous metropolitan area with over 37 million residents in the greater metropolitan region.
best_season: March to May (spring) and September to November (autumn) for mild weather and beautiful cherry blossoms or fall foliage

name: New York City
quick_fact: New York City is made up of five boroughs: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, The Bronx, and Staten Island.
best_season: April to June and September to November for comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds

name: Sydney
quick_fact: The Sydney Opera House is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most recognizable buildings in the world.
best_season: September to November (spring) and March to May (autumn) for mild weather

name: Petra
quick_fact: Petra was established as early as 312 BC as the capital city of the Nabataean Kingdom and is carved directly into rose-red cliffs.
best_season: March to May and September to November for comfortable temperatures

name: Banff National Park
quick_fact: Banff National Park is Canada's oldest national park, established in 1885, and part of the Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks UNESCO World Heritage Site.
best_season: June to August for summer activities and December to March for skiing
